SEARCH
Package com.group7.krisefikser.service

Class UserService

java.lang.Object
com.group7.krisefikser.service.UserService
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UserDetailsService
@Service public class UserService extends Object implements org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UserDetailsService
Service class for handling user-related operations. This class provides methods for user registration, login, and token management. It implements the UserDetailsService interface for loading user details.

  • Method Details

    • loadUserByUsername

      public org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UserDetails loadUserByUsername(String email) throws org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UsernameNotFoundException
      Specified by:
      loadUserByUsername in interface org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UserDetailsService
      Throws:
      org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UsernameNotFoundException

    • registerUser

      public AuthResponse registerUser(RegisterRequest request)
      Registers a new user in the system. This method handles the registration process, including creating a household for the user. It also sends a verification email to the user.
      Parameters:
      request - the registration request containing user details
      Returns:
      an AuthResponse object containing the result of the registration

    • loginUser

      public AuthResponse loginUser(LoginRequest request, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      Logs in a user and generates a JWT token. This method verifies the user's credentials and generates a token if valid. It also checks if the user is verified.
      Parameters:
      request - the login request containing user credentials
      Returns:
      an AuthResponse object containing the result of the login

    • verifyEmail

      public AuthResponse verifyEmail(String token)
      Verifies the user's email using a token. This method checks if the token is valid and updates the user's verification status.
      Parameters:
      token - the verification token
      Returns:
      an AuthResponse object containing the result of the verification

    • resetPassword

      public AuthResponse resetPassword(ResetPasswordRequest request)
      Resets the user's password using a token. This method checks if the token is valid and updates the user's password.
      Parameters:
      request - the reset password request containing the token and new password
      Returns:
      an AuthResponse object containing the result of the password reset

    • sendResetPasswordLink

      public void sendResetPasswordLink(String email)
      Sends a password reset link to the user's email. This method generates a reset token and sends it to the user's email. It also checks if the user exists.
      Parameters:
      email - the user's email address

    • getCurrentUserId

      public Long getCurrentUserId()
      Gets the current authenticated user's ID from the security context.
      Returns:
      the ID of the authenticated user
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if no authenticated user is found

    • getCurrentUser

      public User getCurrentUser()
      Gets the current authenticated user from the repository.
      Returns:
      the authenticated User entity
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the user is not found

    • getCurrentUserHouseholdId

      public int getCurrentUserHouseholdId()
      Gets the household ID of the current authenticated user.
      Returns:
      the household ID of the authenticated user
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the user or their household is not found

    • getUserInfo

      public UserInfoResponse getUserInfo()
      Gets the user information of the current authenticated user.
      Returns:
      a UserInfoResponse object containing user details

    • getUserIdByEmail

      public Long getUserIdByEmail(String email)
      Gets the user ID by email. This method retrieves the user ID associated with the given email address. If the user is not found, it throws a RuntimeException.
      Parameters:
      email - the email address of the user
      Returns:
      the user ID
